channel.title: Can someone toss together a program for me
channel.description: a program demonstrating sending (and receiving) packets (a chat server or something, something sending strings, integers, and other variable types)

item.title: Can someone toss together a program for me
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20071204235511REVISION.zip

It is a revision to an original rsps assistant that I was making at one point of time. It has an organized method of transferring packets to either server or client. Both ends of the protocol use the exact same class and methods to identify and parse packets. It uses some of the sign endian from the rs stream, but nothing really fancy. I just have methods for writing/reading bytes, DWords, QWords, and a String of bytes. I found no need to expand it farther than that.

Read full topic

item.title: Can someone toss together a program for me
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

will this work?

[code]import java.io.DataInputStream;
import java.io.DataOutputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.net.ServerSocket;
import java.net.Socket;
import java.util.ArrayList;

public class mainClass {
private ServerSocket serv = null;
private DataInputStream in = null;
private DataOutputStream out = null;
private ArrayList ips = new ArrayList();
private String inputMessage = “”;
private int legnth = 0;
private Socket soc1 = null;

public mainClass()
{
	try
	{
		serv = new ServerSocket(7357);
	}
	catch (IOException e)
	{
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
	listen();
}

private void listen()
{
	while(true)
	{
		try
		{
			Socket soc = serv.accept();
			in = new DataInputStream(soc.getInputStream());
			System.out.println("Connected");
			
			try
			{
				int i = 0;
				while((i = in.readInt()) != -1)
				{
                                            
					inputMessage = in.readUTF();
					if (inputMessage.startsWith("ip:")) {
						ips.add(inputMessage.substring(4));

					} else {

						legnth = ips.size();
						for (int x = 0;  x <= legnth; x++) {
							try
							{
								soc1 = new Socket(ips.get(x), 7357);
								out = new DataOutputStream(soc1.getOutputStream());
								out.writeUTF(in.readUTF());
							}
							catch (Exception e)
							{
								e.printStackTrace();
							}
						}
					}
					
				}
			}
			catch(Exception e)
			{
				e.printStackTrace();
			}
		}
		catch(Exception e)
		{
			
		}
	}
}
public static void main(String[] args) {
	new mainClass();
}

}[/code]

if the string starts with ip: then it will add an ip to the ip list (this packet will be sent when someone signs on, this is the server side of a chat thing)

if it doesn’t start with ip: then it will go to the for loop and send the string to all of the ips

Read full topic

item.title: Can someone toss together a program for me
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[code]import java.io.DataInputStream;
import java.io.DataOutputStream;
import java.net.Socket;

public class Client
{
private Socket soc = null;
private DataInputStream in = null;
private DataOutputStream out = null;

public Client()
{
	try
	{
		soc = new Socket("localhost", 7357);
		in = new DataInputStream(System.in);
		out = new DataOutputStream(soc.getOutputStream());
	}
	catch (Exception e)
	{
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
	start();
}

public void start()
{
	try
	{
		while(true)
		{
			System.out.print("Message : ");
			String line = in.readLine();

			out.writeInt(0);
			out.writeUTF(line);
			

			System.out.println("Sent packet : 0");
			System.out.println("Message : " + line);
		}
	}
	catch (Exception e)
	{
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
}

public static void main(String[] args)
{
	new Client();
}

}
[/code]

[code]import java.io.DataInputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.net.ServerSocket;
import java.net.Socket;

public class Server
{
private ServerSocket serv = null;
private DataInputStream in = null;

public Server()
{
	try
	{
		serv = new ServerSocket(7357);
	}
	catch (IOException e)
	{
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
	listen();
}

private void listen()
{
	while(true)
	{
		try
		{
			Socket soc = serv.accept();
			in = new DataInputStream(soc.getInputStream());
			
			System.out.println("Connected");

			try
			{
				int i = 0;
				while((i = in.readInt()) != -1)
				{
					System.out.println("Recived Packet : " + i);
					System.out.println("Message : " + in.readUTF() + "\n");
				}
			}
			catch(Exception e)
			{
				e.printStackTrace();
			}
		}
		catch(Exception e)
		{
			
		}
	}
}

public static void main(String[] args)
{
	new Server();
}

}
[/code]

im expecting you know in what order to run them, and which one is which :0

Read full topic
